content:
@Junyan Xu (you seem to have two accounts here). Are you OK with the proof?
I'd like to move this along, since the main Euler Products PR depends on it.

Sorry I didn't have time to look into it further, but #8393 is a golf along the line I suggested. I found docs#tsum_eq_tsum_of_hasSum_iff_hasSum which is quite convenient! Since that lemma exists, maybe we can state all such results in the form of "HasSum iff HasSum", which doesn't require the T2Space assumption, and it would be easy to convert to "tsum eq tsum" when necessary.
I think it is useful to have the "tsum eq tsum" versions, but it certainly also makes sense to state the results in the "HasSum iff HasSum" form.
